page.title: 01North East of Datrlington
page.content: This is an open, undulating, agricultural area with poor natural drainage, exposed to winds throughout the year. The land is highest to the north. Apart from small areas of mainly deciduous woodland there are few trees; generally rather poor specimens with ash, Sycamore and Oak predominating. The primary agricultural production is of milk/beef with cereals, oil-seed, rape and intensively managed grass. Most of the relatively small population is engaged in agriculture or commutes into Darlington or Teesside. Children travel out of the area to school or college. Since there are few facilities for shpping or organised recreation, and puplic transport is infrequent, most families run a car. Thus people can enjoy the peace of village and country life
